title: Cross compiling (conda macOS arm64) fails to build
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/429

The error message is:
```
[ 98%] Linking CXX executable cpptranslate
[ 98%] Built target cpptranslate
[100%] Linking CXX executable lfortran
/bin/sh: /Users/runner/miniforge3/conda-bld/lfortran_1626229184906/work/src/bin/lfortran: Bad CPU type in executable
```
The issue is that the compiled `lfortran` executable is cross-compiled and so it does not run. As such we can't run it to pre-compile the runtime library modules. See https://github.com/conda-forge/lfortran-feedstock/issues/29.

Some solutions that come to mind:

* Compile lfortran twice: once cross-compiled to be included in the Conda package, and once on the host just to compile the runtime library
* Pre-compile the runtime library at LFortran's CI and put it into the source tarball
* Compile runtime library when lfortran is executed for the first time
